poem:
### Presidential Amnesia

In the soft cradle of morning,  
headlines whisper  
of forgotten billionaires,  
pardon-colored smudges on the page.  
Our leader, sleepwalking  
through the corridors of memory,  
traces faint echoes of names—  
Zhao, or was it another?  
They dissolve, like currency,  
into the digital ether,  
leaving only the ghost  
of a handshake behind.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump says he doesn’t know who crypto tycoon is despite having pardoned him Donald Trump has said that he doesn’t know who Changpeng Zhao is despite pardoning the billionaire founder of cryptocurrency exchange Binance in October. The US president was asked in a 60 Minutes interview that aired on Sunday why he pardoned Zhao, who is also known as “CZ”, for enabling money laundering despite him causing “significant harm to … national security” according to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
